Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic little treasure”
Reviews.Author: MacKir
Reviews.Content: We went on a long road trip from Toronto, to New Orleans LA for new years but made a few stops along the way. We got into the habit of stopping at the visitors centers thoughout the states and they always seemed to have the best deals on hotels. When we got to Memphis we were recommended to stay at the comfort inn, right downtown Memphis and it was $85 + tax. which we thought was a great deal for the location, and one of the cheapest places we stayed all trip. They have a comlimentary breakfast, rooms were better than expected , very clean and well appointed.. Would stay here again, and it was a short $1 tram ride to Beale St....the greatest little blues spot we've ever been to....

Reviews.Title: “Memphis Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: Dave W
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean and comfortable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I have stayed at this hotel many times and have never had any issues. Morning breakfast has numerous choices to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good, great rate”
Reviews.Author: jaws1212
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed at a Comfort Inn before, and was very pleasantly surprised. We were there on the marathon weekend, and stayed there with a team from Truman State. The beds were very firm but comfortable, the sheets were soft and not at all scratchy, plenty of pillows, there was a mini-fridge and microwave in the room, and the room was clean and quiet. The towels were on the plush side and very soft. The bathroom shower was best ever, good water pressure, lots of hot water, although an extra light in the shower area would have been nice. The free breakfast was way above average, with all the usuals plus waffles, biscuits and sausage gravy, 3 kinds of fresh fruit, regular and skim milk. Only one minus, the coffee was very weak. But there were a lot of kids there and they had planned for it, nothing ran out but the fruit at the very end. The service at the front desk was efficient and friendly. The rate was $70, which was so much less than most other hotels on that weekend. It was about 12 miles from downtown, all interstate driving, so it was quick to get back downtown, except at rush hour. There is a left, single lane exit when driving east which tends to slow traffic and get backed up - not the hotel's fault, just something to be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyboyTennessee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 8 of the more than dozen motels located at this exit (Sycamore View). My stays have ranged from the pathetic (Red Roof Inn) to the superior (Drury Inn). The Comfort Inn was an above average experience for me on this multi-night stay. A significant discount on this chain prompted me to make a reservation on a "newer" room. The newer features included comfortable bedding/linens, carpet, most furnishings and a bathroom renovation. It was very clean (I check everything!) and odor free. The negatives included a broken window seal (fogged/etched insulated glass), a 20 year old 20" Zenith TV with the inability to hold color, a bad back-up battery that allowed the smoke detector to continously beep when the power failed for 5 hours, a bad shower assembly mixer cartridge that leaked hot water to the rate of about a gallon per hour, peeling wall paper above the tub (I've never seen wallpaper in any bathroom that stays adhered above a tub) and finally I was surprised with a safe fee that I didn't realize was even in the room ($6 stealth fee!). The breakfast had a good selection, was well laid out and was tasty. The coffee, both in the lobby and in the room, was surprisingly very good. I encountered no safety incidents during my visit. Overall, this was a decent experience for me...I've had much worse and I've had better. With a good rate, I would recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Kcindy2000
Reviews.Content: We were on the last leg of our trip and very tired. We were pleased with the comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: tornado6
Reviews.Content: Our very large room had a microwave, fridge, bar area, pull out couch, and two well spaced beds. The bathroom layout was strange, with the sink out in the room and a tiny enclosure for the toilet & shower. The room was cleaned very late (after 4:00) on Saturday, but it was cleaned well every day of our visit. The outdoor pool is really too tiny to do anything but get wet up to the waist, and it was very full on our visit. Don't book this hotel over one without a pool - it really isn't worth it. The breakfast was passable on Saturday and Sunday morning, but there was hardly anything to eat on Monday. The owners were friendly and helpful with local information. The location is fine. We do not feel unsafe in this section of Memphis.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful Hotel to stay at”
Reviews.Author: cwpinkston
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this Hotel for the past 4years and I can tell you that this is a wonderful hotel and the people here are very nice. over the past year the hotel has been updated in the rooms and the overall look of the hotel. if you want a place to stay at with a safe and clean this is the place. take my word for it, i only want to stay at the best.

Reviews.Title: “OMG the smell!”
Reviews.Author: Wataugagal
Reviews.Content: Checked in -- wish I had walked in and cancelled. The odor in the room was horrendous. Tried opening the window to air, however when closing the window the odor accumulated to the point that it would give you a headache. It was a nicely decorated room and spacious with a wonderful showerhead but just can't understand the odor. Tried an air freshner but to no avail -- just go somewhere else. I assure you that it's worth more than the odor (possibly a spray they use).

Reviews.Title: “Musty and Humid Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lsglitter88
Reviews.Content: Outside of the hotel looked decent, lady at the front desk was nice and helpful (the pool was closed for cleaning but they notified us as soon as it opened so my 5 year old could go swimming). At first glance, room looked clean and was a nice size...2 queen beds, fridge, desk, couch etc. BUT....the couch, blankets on the beds, and carpet were wet, not soaking, but very very damp..the room was so humid and musty/sticky that I put my suitcase out in the trunk of my car so my clothes wouldnt get damp and smelly. Also, when we flushed the toilet (in the teeny tiny bathroom with no vent), the noise was so loud/long running that it woke up my son twice. The breakfast was okay except the hard boiled eggs...they tasted like they had been last weeks leftovers and they made my dad gag. This was my first trip to Memphis and I will NEVER go back. 80% of the city is run down, abandoned buildings and closed down businesses, high weeds/grass/grafiti everywhere. We stopped to see Elvis' house and felt unsafe walking down the street. Definately NOT what I had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Has Ants and Worst Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AccurateDescriptions
Reviews.Content: Room looked very nice when we first walked in and then the ants starting showing up shortly thereafter. There were ants on the tables, sheets, pillowcases, etc. I also saw ants by the ice machine in the vending area. One time we saw more than 20 ants on the table and there wasn't any food on it. They also have the worst breakfast. No muffins, danishes, oatmeal or english muffins. Biscuits were hard as a rock and gravy was cold. Waffle batter was very runny and wasn't edible. When we came back to the room in the afternoon both of our keys didn't work. We left a note for housekeeping not to clean the room or make the bed just leave toiletries, towels, etc. They moved our note to the table and disregarded it. The room was made up as if we had already checked out. We only stayed 2 days and had to get out of there. They also tried to charge us for a safe and warranty. Watch your receipt carefully as they charge for this daily and it shows up separately on the receipt. The swimming pool looked very dirty so it wasn't an option to use it. We also never saw any other guests using the swimming pool. We complained to Choice Hotels and we received a credit for one nights hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room was filthy, property in general was filthy.”
Reviews.Author: ChuckL50
Reviews.Content: We were too tired upon arrival to closely inspect our room, but in the morning we found trash left in the refrigerator as well as empty fast food containers including pizza boxes in cupboards. Found more trash in the dresser drawers. The floor did not appear to be vacuumed at all. The overall appearance of the public areas of this property should be a warning sign to anyone. No maintenance, no housekeeping. I did not receive a copy of my bill on check out. I was emailed a PDF of it, and discovered that I had been charged for the safe which we did not use. I expect that the safe is also full of trash.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but pricey and characterless”
Reviews.Author: JoW2009
Reviews.Content: Fine location - v easy to drive to and near enough to downtown and Beale Street etc. Rather expensive for the facilities Had mixed up booking and tried to give us room with no window, changed it for one with two beds - not what we had booked Pool was small and over-chlorinated Breakfast fine

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: smarks1
Reviews.Content: Comfort inn, 1335 McRee St. Memphis, TN. This hotel is ok. The night manager was not happy to be there. When I entered the hotel, she was sitting in the lobby area watching TV. She looked up at me, like what do you want. She finally said something like yea? I told her I had a reservation and she got up and went behind the desk. She asked my name. She handed me a room key, told me the room was upstairs. Not another word. She didn't ask for my credit card to copy or anything. The hotel has no elevator and the hallways are dirty. The room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: J-in-TX
Reviews.Content: For $60, this is a fine place to spend a night. I was originally a little concerned about the neighborhood, but unless you are willing to pay $200+ a night, it appears that all of your hotel choices are in "iffy" neighborhoods. Turns out, the concern was misplaced-- there were no problems and we didn't even hear any sirens, which is better than home! The staff was great-- very attentive and helpful. The breakfast was average. The breakfast area and rooms were very clean. (Bedding and linens appear new.) However, the rest of the hotel is in need of MAJOR renovations. The hallways are dingy and dirty-- yuck! I wouldn't want to stay here for an extended visit to Memphis, but it is just fine for a quick stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: WendyJG
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Comfort Inn in Memphis after originally planning to be there just one night - but there's so much to see and do in Memphis (and I don't mean Graceland either) that we decided to spend two more nights there. I'm glad they were able to get us in, because the Liberty Bowl was happening and the hotel filled up really quickly. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and leaving out a tray of cookies & fresh coffee in the afternoon was a nice touch. And we were happy that we had some protein options with the continental breakfast (yogurt, hardboiled eggs) as well as the habit-forming buttermilk biscuits :) There was secured parking in the garage for $5 a day, and going in-and-out was not an issue (which was good because while the Comfort Inn is downtown, it's further than one would think from some major attractions). There was a safe in our room which we did not use, and a daily safe charge appeared on our bill - it was removed once I explained to the desk clerk that we never used the safe. As another reviewer noted, the bathroom sink area was granite and marble - nicer than what I'd expect for a mid-level chain. The room was spotless and kept so during our stay. And the fact that the hotel was full of Mississippi State fans and still quiet must mean that the walls are adequately thick :) I really liked Memphis, much more so than Nashville - it's got a friendlier, more welcoming vibe and this was reflected in the staff from those at the front desk to housekeeping. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: vlvo4life
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. The room was quite large and had a mini fridge, coffee pot, iron, ironing board, hair drier and microwave. The continental breakfast included hot waffles. The furniture and fabrics were upscale (granite counter tops in the bathroom) but showed a little bit of wear. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location felt relatively safe, and the parking lot was well lit. It was convieniently close to the highway but still quiet. I will definately be staying at the Comfort Inn on future trips to Memphis.
